About: Inventor and entrepreneur.
Experience: Executive Chairman & Founder, Biosplice Therapeutics · Full-time, Mar 2021 - Present · 1 yr 5 mos, San Diego, California, United States, Biosplice Therapeutics is developing first-in-class, small-molecule therapeutics based on pioneering science of alternative pre-mRNA splicing. Stemming from foundational discoveries in Wnt pathway modulation, Biosplice has elucidated novel biology linking CLK/DYRK kinases to the therapeutic regulation of alternative splicing. Alternative splicing is an essential biological mechanism that regulates the diversification of proteins in a cell, which, in turn, determines cell type and function. Biosplice’s target class governs the selection of tissue-specific mRNA splice sites, making them attractive, druggable targets within the cellular “command and control” center. Biosplice’s drugs in clinical development include lorecivivint for osteoarthritis (in Phase 3), cirtuvivint for numerous cancers, and a broad pipeline that ranges from Alzheimer’s disease to other degenerative conditions. About:
Life Sciences Experience – Led multi-level teams in sales, account management, operations, strategy, marketing and communications, in organizations stretching from Fortune 5 to mid-size to pre-IPO.  Responsible for P&Ls from $130m to $1.6B with divergent challenges, opportunities and profit margins.  Led strategy through execution from drug development and labeling to commercialization/launch to end of lifecycle across numerous markets and therapeutic areas, inclusive of pharmaceuticals and diagnostics.

Transformational Leadership– 6 years of executive (VP to C-suite) level experience leading full functional teams in strategy, marketing, sales and operations.  Expert in leading transformation and change to successful outcomes.  Led 3 integrations at 3 organizations – as both the acquiring and acquired.  Restructured key functional areas to meet customer, growth and efficiency goals inclusive of sales, marketing, trade/contracting, account management, and commercial operations, insights and strategy.  Brought to market one of the most efficient and flexible models of commercial support in the biopharma industry.   

Results Orientation – Built numerous high performing teams, led turnarounds and delivered exceptional growth on top and bottom line.  Deliver comprehensive assessments, set vision and strategy and drive to execution.  Ensure results through strategically aligned KPIs and incentive plans, appropriate empowerment and accountability, alignment of corporate goals through the individual level and efficient and effective deployment of resources.

Broad Oncology Expertise – 13+ years of experience in the Oncology market.  Deep understanding of the end to end channel of Oncology and delivery of care.  Led marketing, strategy, HEOR, sales, NCI/NCCN account management, oncology nurse educators, FRMs, and patient access teams in multiple tumor types for both med and hem onc therapeutic markets, as well as diagnostics.

Engaged and Values-Based Culture – Significant personal commitment to ensuring a culture of high-performance in a values-based way.  Tie all performance and development reviews, reward and recognition to corporate values and strategic priorities.  Leverage six sigma tools to create culture of empowerment and accountability.  Take personal pride in strong team building, mentoring, and staff development ensuring a disciplined and systematic deployment across the organization.

Notable deals include: 1) Raised $830 million in growth equity capital at a post-money valuation of $7.83 billion in May 2021. With this investment, Caris has raised approximately $1.3 billion in external financing since 2018. This financing represents one of the largest capital raises in precision medicine and includes a diverse syndicate of leading investors. The round was led by Sixth Street, a leading global investment firm making its third investment in Caris since 2018. T. Rowe Price, Silver Lake, Fidelity and Coatue were significant participants in the round. Additional investors included Columbia Threadneedle, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, Millennium, Neuberger Berman, Highland Capital, Rock Springs Capital, OrbiMed, ClearBridge, Tudor Investment, Eaton Vance, Pura Vida and First Light Asset Management. 2) Raised $310 million in growth capital from a broad syndicate of leading investors in October 2020. The financing included $235 million in equity financing co-led by Highland Capital and Coatue, with participation from T. Rowe Price, OrbiMed, Millennium, Neuberger Berman, ClearBridge, First Light Asset Management and others. The Company also raised $75 million in debt from Sixth Street as an extension to the $150 million in structured debt financing Sixth Street invested in September 2018. About:
General Counsel with extensive experience overseeing all corporate legal and compliance functions for top healthcare and biotechnology companies. Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain legal and healthcare compliance programs and provide leadership for all corporate law matters including M&A diligence, transactional documents, company litigation, intellectual property, and managed care.

Dedicated leader with excellent communication skills and a proven track record of success building and implementing compliance programs, providing direction and oversight to external counsel, and negotiating and closing complex transactions.

►	Healthcare & Biotechnology Leadership: Skilled Attorney in all aspects of healthcare including regulatory, compliance, IP, and complex transactions involving pharmaceutical companies, academic medical centers, and data sales. Successfully built and implemented complex compliance programs at Caris Life Sciences and Miraca Life Sciences.

►	M&A Expertise: Extensive experience leading 30+ M&A transactions. As SVP and General Counsel at Caris Life Sciences, led the M&A transaction for the acquisition of Molecular Profiling Institute, which became Caris Life Sciences Inc.  This led to the advent of molecular profiling, which is now a standard of care for later stage cancer patients.

►	Executive Leadership Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to collaborate with CEOs, senior leadership teams, and Boards of Directors. Background includes experience serving as a Corporate Secretary responsible for making quarterly Board presentations and setting up multiple Board Committees.

Passionate executive with 15+ years’ experience leading teams to build and/or extract maximum value from internal/external scientific and clinical opportunities to advance organizational pipeline development and strategic goals. I care about people and prioritize talent development for both my teams and throughout my organization.

I have deep subject matter expertise, strategic vision, and outstanding communication and trust building skills that have resulted in tangible successes in each of my roles across industry and academia.

I have enjoyed time as an independent investigator and leader across therapeutic areas and organizations (industry / academia / government / non-profits),  with extensive international / global experience.

As a person, I love soccer (playing, watching, anything) and sports in general, when I travel I prefer to just walk around and explore rather than overly plan (especially in Paris, France where I spent 4 years as a teenager), and I try to surround myself with people who are genuine and respectful of others.

About:
Physician-scientist, board-certified pathologist, and healthcare executive with expertise in precision medicine, molecular diagnostics, liquid biopsy, solid tumors, hematologic malignancy, digital pathology, and laboratory management. Experienced with regulatory submissions to MolDx, NYSDH, CAP, ISO15189 on behalf of new laboratory technology and quality management. Team leader for CAP regulated laboratory inspections.

I am currently the Executive Medical Director at Caris Life Sciences where I lead a group of 24 pathologists and 6 molecular geneticists. I head our Quality and Digital Pathology operations.

I am an experienced Hematopathologist and laboratory medical director with:
- Board Certification in Anatomic and Clinical Pathology
- Board Certification in Hematopathology
- Medical Licensure in California, Wisconsin, Arizona, and Texas
- New York State Department of Health Laboratory Director Certificate of Qualification (Cellular Immunology, Immunophenotyping, Diagnostic Immunology, Hematology, Histopathology, Molecular and Cellular Tumor Markers)

About: David is combining the speed of entrepreneurship with the rigor of data science to reinvent mental healthcare delivery. David is the Chief Executive Officer of Cerebral, a leading tele-mental health company committed to improving access to high quality care. Cerebral has improved the lives of hundreds of thousands of Americans across all 50 states. Previously, David was President, Co-founder and Chief Medical Officer of Valera Health, a tele-mental health service that was able to reduce hospitalizations for patients with serious mental illness. David is on faculty at Harvard Medical School, and he is the Director of the Innovations Council for Massachusetts General Hospital's Psychiatry Department. He has conducted research on how technology can help better predict and prevent suicidal behaviors.  David has been named 'Top 10 under 35 for Healthcare' by LinkedIn, as well as '40 under 40' for healthcare innovation by MedTech Boston. David is a Soros Fellow, a Gates Scholar, a Horatio Alger National Scholar, and a member of World Economic Forum Global Shapers and the Academy of Achievement. He graduated from Harvard College with a degree in neurobiology, and earned his MD MBA from Harvard Medical School and Harvard Business School. His writings have appeared in the New England Journal of Medicine and Stat.

About:
Jeff is Senior Vice President, Commercial & B2B and a member of the Executive Team at Cerebral, the fastest growing mental health company in history focused on improving access to affordable, high-quality care to everyone who needs it. He is responsible for building the B2B business, with a focus on partnerships, customer acquisition, customer success, marketing, product, business model development, strategy and talent management. 

Previously, Jeff was a Founding Team member and Senior Vice President at Quartet Health, a leading healthcare technology company that connects patients, physicians, mental health providers and payers to effectively improve health outcomes. Jeff scaled Quartet Health from an idea to a national business made up of 300+ employees with over $160M in funding. Previous roles spanned go-to-market strategy, product, operations, account management, business development, corporate development, M&A, and strategy.

A serial entrepreneur and passionate healthcare advocate, Jeff's additional experience includes launching a range of software and technology companies, driving clinical research at the NIH, and leading healthcare investments for J.P. Morgan.

Unlike traditional mental health care, Cerebral is accessible, convenient, affordable, and free of stigma. Members receive online access to prescribing providers, behavioral counselors, and talk therapists—all from the comfort of home or anywhere else with an internet connection. Visits are done via video chat, and members can message their care team directly. Members receive medications delivered straight to their door (if prescribed). About:
As an expert in highly regulated industries with strong ethical decision-making, business, and legal acumen, I develop compliance, ethics, risk management strategies and roadmaps, policies and procedures, and governance infrastructures to scale effective people-first and risk-reduced organizations.

Throughout my career, I have successfully influenced buy-in, adoption of culture change, and engagement in compliance and ethics initiatives in large-scale enterprises. I have also addressed organizational gaps and implemented strategic risk programs at the forefront of complex landmark regulations, including the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, HITECH, PCI, and GDPR, as well as HIPAA, EMTALA, Physician Payment Sunshine Act, FCA, AKS, STARK, and FCPA. In my recent role as Virginia Commonwealth University’s chief ethics and compliance officer, I led best practices for corporate and regulatory compliance, communication initiatives, KPIs, KRIs, monitoring and reports, emerging risk trend identification, compliance investigations, policy creation, and federal and state mandates across 30 business units. Career accomplishments include:

--Establishing and growing numerous infrastructures and initiatives to fuel ethics and compliance strategies for Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU), including the institution’s first annual compliance training and its first interactive digital code of conduct decision-making tool with 70 pages of content and cited resource tools. 
--Securing buy-in from 90 matrixed key opinion leaders at VCU to drive best practices, KPIs, evaluation and clarification of current university risk and ethics policies, and new policy creation for emerging risk trends.
--Circumventing millions of dollars in government payer penalties and fines for the VCU Health System through process improvements to the system’s workflows, patient communication initiatives for privacy breaches, healthcare costs, and staff training and education. 

I am always open to expanding my professional network. If you would like to connect, please contact me via LinkedIn or at jkniska@msn.com.

Experience: Cityblock Health, 4 yrs 11 mos, Brooklyn, NYC, Co-founder, Chief Technical Product Officer, Feb 2019 - Present · 3 yrs 6 mos, technology.cityblock.com Cityblock is novel healthcare provider and technology company, based out of Brooklyn, and backed by $800M in venture funding. Started in the fall of 2017, Cityblock has quickly grown to 1,000+ employees serving tens of thousands of patients across the Northeast. Our focus is on medically complex and socially underserved Medicaid populations, and our doctors and nurses deliver a home-based intensive primary care model with integrated behavioral health, substance abuse counseling, and social benefits coordination (think: housing support, legal support). About:
Dr. Matthews seeks to focus on larger health policy issues that impact underserved patient populations - access to care and financing, health disparities, social determinants of health, primary care and the medical home. She is a clinician, advocate, administrator, and academic. Initially having worked in correctional medicine, she transitioned to administration within federally qualified health centers (FQHCs), which provide community-based primary care and wrap-around social services. She believes in the FQHC as a meaningful structure for the delivery of care and therefore serves on multiple national and state committees focused on clinical implementation and advocacy issues on behalf of FQHCs.

Having joined the US Department of Veterans Affairs in 2016, she led the newly created Office of Community Care into unprecedented transformation. She successfully implemented the new Veteran Community Care Program under the MISSION Act, deployed the Community Care Network national contracts through the majority of the country, and has transformed the provider claims processing efforts.  Then as Chief Medical Officer of the largest health care system in the world, she assisted with the further transformation of this high quality, high performing integrated network, including serving as the VHA Functional Champion for the EHR Modernization to Cerner commercial product.

With the additional interest in workforce diversity and development, she is former faculty for medical students and residents in both the clinical setting and the classroom. She continues to develop multiple mentoring relationships with students in order to encourage the advancement of future minority physicians, professionals and leaders. With this in mind, along with another young practicing physician, she co-founded the Tour for Diversity in Medicine which seeks to motivate and inspire high school and college students around the nation - visit www.tour4diversity.org for more information.

Specialties: family medicine, correctional medicine, healthcare disparities, health equity, organizational leadership, organizational medicine, primary care, access to care, mentoring, workforce diversity, community health, community health center, FQHC, veterans health administration, veterans

About:
Forbes #20 of 50 Most Influential CMOs in the World || Marketing Dive Executive of the Year ||  Restaurant Business Power 20 || AdAge Campaign of the Year || Brandia:  Heroes of Marketing || University of Cincinnati Herman Schneider Distinguished Alumni Award

Globally recognized business leader and brand builder who believes that “Nothing Great Happens when You’re Comfortable” in both life and business. Known for inspiring multi-discipline teams to deliver bold work that is more than they thought possible, orchestrating blockbuster innovation, viral culture moments, cutting edge digital and social campaigns and sustained business performance. Passionate, value-based leader who has moved with ease and built winning teams across industries, consistently driving industry leading growth across highly competitive and complex categories including CPG and QSR, brand and performance marketing, e-commerce and traditional retail, leading and challenger brands.

Skillsets and Experiences:
• P&L responsibility (+$3.0Bn sales).
• Franchisee Leadership/Partnership
• Talent attraction and development, consistently developing and promoting talent ahead of peers.
• E-commerce growth in both owned channels and aggregators/retailers.
• Global leadership including geographic expansion and all BRIC countries.
• Innovation strategy, development and in market delivery, including retailer co-development.
• Consumer and Shopper data and insights leadership and application.
• Retailer/Brand joint business planning to deliver win/win across Big Box, Small Box and Pure Play.
• Brand Architecture, Equity and holistic advertising ownership including consumer targeting, digital and performance marketing and capability, shopper marketing and managing multiple agencies across disciplines.
• Market analysis including market mix and assortment optimization, pricing, and overall business drivers.
• Internal & External Public Relations
• Multi-functional team leadership and organization capability building.
• Strong collaboration across matrix organization.

About: Todd Park is Co-Founder and Executive Chairman of Devoted Health, a company focused on dramatically improving the health and well-being of older Americans by caring for each and every person like they are literally family.  Prior to co-founding Devoted, Todd served as White House technology advisor based in Silicon Valley from August 2014 to January 2017.  In this role, he focused on bringing top technology talent and best practices into government to improve service delivery, national defense, public engagement, and more.  Prior to this role, Todd served from March 2012 to August 2014 as U.S Chief Technology Officer (CTO) in the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy and, in that position, served as an Assistant to the President.  Todd joined the Obama Administration in August 2009 as CTO of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), where he functioned as an “entrepreneur-in-residence,” helping HHS harness the power of data, technology, and innovation to improve the health of the nation.  For his work at HHS, Todd was named one of Fast Company’s “100 Most Creative People in Business” in 2010.  Prior to his work in government, Todd co-founded pioneering health information technology company Athenahealth in 1997 and co-led its development over a decade into a leading national provider of cloud-based software and services for physicians and health care practitioners.  He also co-founded Castlight Health, an innovative online health benefits platform company, in 2008 and has served as a senior advisor to Ashoka, a global incubator of social entrepreneurs, where he helped start a venture to bring affordable telehealth services, medications, diagnostics, and clean water to rural India.  Todd graduated magna cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa from Harvard College with an A.B. in economics.  He currently serves on the boards of New America and The Public Health Company and on the Obama Foundation's Digital & Technology Council.  Todd was elected a Fellow of the National Academy of Public Administration in 2017 and was awarded an honorary Doctor of Public Service degree by American University in 2021.  He is a member of the 2017 Class of Henry Crown Fellows within the Aspen Global Leadership Network at the Aspen Institute.

About:
In October 2021, Mo joined the leadership of Devoted Health as the company's first Chief Legal and External Affairs Officer, overseeing all legal and public affairs for this tech-enabled growth healthcare company. 

Prior to joining Devoted, Mo served as President, Global Government Affairs and Policy (GAP) and leader of GE’s national executive teams in Europe and Canada, advising GE’s Corporate and portfolio business leadership on policy issues and serving as GE's primary interlocutor for policy makers, government officials, and key political stakeholders globally. Mo previously served as Vice President, Litigation and Legal Policy for the Company, overseeing litigation, enforcement proceedings, investigations and compliance globally. 

Before joining GE, Mo held leadership roles (President and CEO, May 2016-March 2017; SVP and COO, November 2013-April 2016) with ML Strategies, a government relations and consulting group based in Boston and Washington, DC, and Mintz, Levin, Cohn, Ferris, Glovsky and Popeo, PC (Of Counsel, Member of firm Policy and Compensation committees). Mo served as a Fellow at the Harvard University Institute of Politics for the Fall semester of 2013.

On January 30, 2013, Governor Deval L. Patrick appointed Mo to serve as interim United States Senator upon the resignation of John F. Kerry.

Prior to his Senate appointment, Mo served Governor Patrick in a variety of leadership positions, including Chief Legal Counsel, Chief of Staff, and Senior Advisor. 

Mo is a graduate of Duke University and Northeastern University School of Law. He holds honorary degrees from Georgetown University, Newbury College, and Bridgewater State University.

Mo is a member of the US Association of Former Members of Congress and serves on the boards of: Goldfinch Bio, Edward M. Kennedy Institute for the United States Senate, Massachusetts General Hospital, MassChallenge and the New Commonwealth Racial Equity and Social Justice Fund.

Kennedy School of Government, was established in 1966 as a memorial to President Kennedy. The IOP’s mission is to unite and engage students, particularly undergraduates, with academics, politicians, activists, and policymakers on a non-partisan basis to inspire them to consider careers in politics and public service. The Institute strives to promote greater understanding and cooperation between the academic world and the world of politics and public affairs. About:
Nancy is an experienced marketing leader specializing in envisioning and launching new mass household brands. She is an industry-agnostic organizational executive focused on growth. Currently serving as Chief Marketing Officer for fastest growing tech-led health startup Devoted Health, on a mission to improve the healthcare experience and outcomes for older Americans. Previously responsible for launching or accelerating growth for a range of consumer companies, from multi-billion dollar brands such as Wayfair, Chewy, and P&G/Gillette, to early stage startups such as Dia (fashion), Tally (fintech), and Arteza (art supplies).

Nancy is personally invested in mentorship and entrepreneurship, serving on the board of Big Sisters Association of Boston and Duke’s Innovation and Entrepreneurship Advisory Committee, and as a mentor/speaker for HBS Startup Bootcamp and Praxis Labs.

Devoted's all-in-one offering includes Medicare Advantage health plans, specialized provider services, health coordination, and customized care. Devoted's end product is better health through the delivery of higher quality, more affordable, and a more caring healthcare experience. First serving customers in January 2019, followed by sequential years of record-breaking growth. About:
We had thought that the Affordable care Act was the greatest transformation in US healthcare since the introduction of Medicare.   
Despite vastly greater access to healthcare coverage, we have not controlled the cost of healthcare nor delivered yet on promises of enhanced outcomes and patient experience.
I have had the privilege to experience the full gamut of the industry from providers to payers, technology developers, scientists and  investors throughout the country and in other parts of the world. 

My focus has always been the continuum of care across the full healthcare spectrum.  The providers of healthcare - physicians, nurses and all others in the delivery chain remain a passion. The leverage of technology as it evolves particularly Virtual Health is top of mind. 

Devoted Health allows me the privilege  and great pleasure to leverage unique leadership, vision, technology and resources to transform healthcare delivery. The proof of concept has been coupled with a single corporate directive, which drives decision on the basis of treating each person like ones own loved ones.  www.devoted.com





.

Regionalization was a new concept. I was recruited to inaugurate my role and lay the groundwork for a network of physicians with hospitals throughout the enterprise in collaboration with unique partners, Weill Cornell Medicine (WCM) and Columbia Doctors (CD). Working together, our teams established standardized methodologies for Clinical Service deployment of WCM and CD to our regional network. In addition we initiated numerous hospital programs regionally led by physicians from both schools. The New York Presbyterian Medical Groups (NYPMG) were created and co-branded with WCM and CD in their respective catchment areas as the third physician arm of NYP. The newly formed NYP Physician Services Organization, with a new practice management infrastructure provides practice management services to over 1000 NYPMG providers (850 physicians),including some WCM and CD physicians. It is a privilege to witness the establishment of a new enterprise within one of the nations top hospital systems. We were able to initiate advanced programs in Patient Engagement, Quality of Care and Digital Health leveraging NYP resources as well as WCM and CD thought leaders. Enterprise wide service lines became possible in Cancer and Cardiovascular Disease as well as the deployment of other services from the academic medical centers to the regional system. The breadth and depth of the enterprise with its resources and talent lent itself to the rapid achievement of scale and excellence in multiple modalities in a relatively short period of time. The further evolution of the enterprise will no doubt make an impact both nationally and beyond as it continues to define itself as both a national leader and regional enterprise. , New York Presbyterian (NYP) is the largest academic medical center in the US and differentiated by its affiliation with two Ivy League Medical Schools and its national recognition as New York's leading hospital in multiple specialties for many years. About:
I'm empowering the People Team at Lyra Health. Join us as we change the landscape of mental health: https://www.lyrahealth.com/careers/.

At Lyra, I lead people operations, recruiting, total rewards, talent development, and deib (diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging). Previously, I was an HR executive at Gusto, where throughout the years, I oversaw internal communications, people operations, total rewards, people analytics, and L&D.

I'm also on the board of directors for i4cp, the leading authority on next practices in human capital. 
-- -- --
One of my favorite (and humbling) notes shared with me from a startup CEO: "Stephanie has a wonderful blend of people+business skills (and experience!), that's not easy to find. She has led a lot of the foundational HR work at fast-growing companies."

About:
As CEO and Co-founder of Noom, a consumer-led digital health platform, I have spent 13 years building a passionate team dedicated to our mission of helping people everywhere live healthier lives. Through a powerful combination of human coaching, psychology, and technology, we are empowering our Noomers to take control of their health and change their behaviors for good.

Coming from a family of doctors in South Korea, I have always had an intense desire to help people. From an early age, I knew my life’s work would be dedicated to improving the wellbeing of as many people as possible. After losing my father at a young age, I became more motivated than ever to truly change lives for the better and to channel my entrepreneurial spirit (I founded South Korea’s first-ever heavy metal record label) to make an impact. After dropping out of college and moving to the US, I met my co-founder Artem Petakov, who shared his vision of helping people live healthier lives, and convinced him to leave Google to develop Noom. As CEO, I am responsible for setting the strategic vision for Noom and have led the company through several years of tremendous growth, helping millions of people improve their lifestyles and health. In 2020, I was named EY Entrepreneur of the Year.

About:
Noom is growing like a rocketship lately, and helping millions get healthier using technology & psychology! We are looking for amazing engineers, health coaches, operations & support folks and more. Check out our jobs page for more (noom.com/careers/), and feel free to reach out with questions.

More about me:
I've been interested in the intersection between technology and psychology my whole life. My biggest passion is influencing people's everyday decisions on a large scale, especially in the cases where these decisions will greatly benefit them long-term. Wellness is by far my favorite of these areas.

Here are some fun things not covered below:
* Started programming when I was 9 on an "Elektronika MK-61" calculator.
* Grew up in Kiev, Ukraine, moved to U.S. when I was 13.
* Took Daniel Kanheman's "Psychology of Decision Making" class at Princeton, making me forever fall in love with psychology of decision-making.
* I love books (Clay Christensen, Andy Grove, Yalom).

About:
Dr. Jeremy Friese, MD MBA, is a physician executive with a demonstrated passion for improving healthcare, first as a physician executive at Mayo Clinic then as a successful entrepreneur. As Olive’s President, Payer Market, Jeremy is on a mission to transform healthcare for the good of patients, providers, and payers. His responsibilities span all activities related to Olive’s rapidly growing Payer business and coordination with Olive’s established Provider business to deliver value across the healthcare ecosystem. 

Prior to Olive, Jeremy started or invested in dozens of healthcare companies and most recently founded and led Verata Health, a venture-backed AI technology company acquired by Olive in 2019. Prior to his transition to entrepreneurship, Jeremy was an internationally recognized physician and executive at Mayo Clinic and Harvard. During his Mayo career, he held executive leadership positions for Mayo’s most profitable business, the Mayo Clinic Strategic Investment Fund, and Global Business Development. Additionally, Jeremy served as a director on several US and international boards for leading venture firms, the International Monetary Fund and the American Cancer Society. 

Jeremy earned his MD at Mayo Clinic School of Medicine and his MBA at Harvard Business School.

About:
Rohan D’Souza is currently the Chief Product Officer at Olive. 

Prior to joining Olive Rohan was Vice President and Head of Product at KenSci, a Machine Learning platform built specifically for healthcare that’s on a mission to fight death with data science. At KenSci, Rohan was accountable for driving the innovation and product strategy in bringing machine learning solutions to some of the largest and most prestigious health systems in the world, aligned to achieving the quadruple aim of healthcare. KenSci has pioneered a suite of machine learning models that are tuned to indicators that improve operational efficiencies, clinical quality, and financial profitability on a highly scalable, elastic cloud framework. 

Prior to joining KenSci, Rohan was instrumental in building an industry leading population health solution at eClinicalWorks from the ground up. With over 100M patient’s data flowing through the platform, he helped some of the largest and most successful ACO’s in the US to understand opportunities within their data and build intervention strategies to drive change. 

He is also a leading voice for the open health data initiative and was responsible for pushing the agenda on EMR systems adopting an open API framework for healthcare interoperability. 

Rohan graduated from the University at Buffalo with a double degree in Biological Sciences and Business Marketing, focused on the intersection of health policy with biostatistics. His research helped guide the University at Buffalo to become the first public University in the state of New York to go completely tobacco free. While at UB, he was also a D1 Scholarship recipient on the Mens Swimming and Diving Team, the first Indian Swimmer to receive a college scholarship in the US. Rohan was an internationally recognized swimmer winning numerous medals across the Asian Swimming Circuit. 

When not geeking out on data, Rohan likes to blog about cooking and mentor aspiring data explorers on the promise that a data driven world is better in every possible way.

Olive’s vision is to unleash a trillion dollars of hidden potential within healthcare by connecting its disconnected systems. About:
I am the Chief Technology Office at Olive, passionate in pushing the bounds of possible to solve some of today's toughest challenges.  I am focused on brining the latest in artificial intelligence, machine learning, semantic technologies, process automation and beyond to drive revolutionary change in healthcare.  Since joining Olive in 2013 I have overseen the release and evolution of Olive's market-leading healthcare automation platform.

I am focused on building a world-class engineering culture that is always pushing the bounds of what is possible.  Being deployed at many the largest healthcare providers I have led our team in scaling our core technologies and infrastructure to support rapid growth while also engaging in new product development and innovation efforts.

Prior to Olive I spent some time in the media industry leading the engineering efforts for a conglomerate of newspapers, TV, and Radio stations building out their web and mobile presence and helping the company embrace the rapidly changing media consumption landscape.

When not focused on Olive's vision of changing healthcare you can find me traveling, biking, and running marathons.

About:
Dr. YiDing Yu is a practicing physician and serial entrepreneur passionate about transforming the way we deliver healthcare. Named woman entrepreneur of the year in 2018 by the Cartier Women’s Initiative Awards, YiDing is skilled business operator and passionate public speaker who has launched and scaled innovations across the healthcare ecosystem.

YiDing is Chief Medical Officer at Olive, a multi-billion healthcare AI company on a mission to unleash a trillion dollars of hidden potential within health care. Prior to Olive, YiDing was Chief Medical Officer at Verata Health, a leading health care AI company backed by BCBS Venture Partners, Bessemer, LRV Health, and 3M. At Verata, YiDing led marketing, customer operations, and payer partnerships, until Verata's acquisition by Olive in 2020. 

A serial entrepreneur, YiDing also founded and served as CEO of Twiage, an award-winning healthcare tech platform for emergency responders, which she also successfully exited. YiDing began her career at Mass General Brigham, where she received the President’s Prize of Value-Based Healthcare Delivery. She’s also served as Chief Innovation Engineer of Atrius Health, a $2B health system in Boston, MA. Recognized throughout her career for her groundbreaking work, YiDing has won top innovation prizes from the American Heart Association, the American Medical Association, and the Cleveland Clinic.

YiDing received her BA in Economics, magna cum laude, from Harvard University. She has conducted research as a Doris Duke Clinical Research Fellow, designed health information systems for health departments in Myanmar, published in peer-reviewed medical journals, presented at national conferences, and received the 2013 Johns Hopkins Diane Becker Research Award in Clinical Epidemiology.

An international keynote speaker, YiDing has headlined events for Elle Magazine, Cartier, the American Medical Association, and the American Heart Association.
Experience: Chief Medical Officer, EVP, and General Manager, Olive · Full-time, Dec 2020 - Present · 1 yr 8 mos, I am Chief Medical Officer at Olive and General Manager of Olive's largest business unit, leading our prior authorization portfolio and all of Olive's payer market solutions. Olive is the automation company built specifically for healthcare. About:
Eric Lefkofsky is the founder and CEO of Tempus, a leading provider of technology enabled precision medicine solutions. He is a founding partner of Lightbank, a venture fund investing in disruptive technologies. He is also the co-founder and Chairman of Groupon (NASDAQ: GRPN), a global e-commerce marketplace, and co-founder of Mediaocean, a leading provider of integrated media procurement technology; Echo Global Logistics (NASDAQ: ECHO), a technology-enabled transportation and logistics outsourcing firm; and InnerWorkings (NASDAQ: INWK), a global provider of managed print and promotional solutions.

Lefkofsky is a Trustee of Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago, The Art Institute of Chicago, The Museum of Science and Industry and World Business Chicago. He is also Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Chicago's Steppenwolf Theatre Company. Lefkofsky is also an adjunct professor at the University of Chicago. Eric Lefkofsky graduated from the University of Michigan and received his Juris Doctor at University of Michigan Law School. 
 
Specialties: Turning conventional businesses into e-enabled businesses with technology serving as a catalyst to revolutionize the conventional business process.
 
http://www.lefkofsky.com
Experience: Founder and CEO, Tempus, Inc., 2015 - Present · 7 yrs 7 mos, Greater Chicago Area, Tempus is a technology company that is building the world’s largest library of molecular and clinical data and an operating system to make that data accessible and useful. We enable physicians to deliver personalized care for patients through our interactive analytical and machine learning platform. We provide genomic sequencing services and analyze molecular and therapeutic data to empower physicians and researchers to make real-time, data-driven decisions. Our goal is for each patient to benefit from the treatment of others who came before by providing the health care industry with tools that learn as we gather more data. About:
Andy Polovin serves as the General Counsel at Tempus Labs, Inc., a precision medicine company that is changing the face of healthcare. Tempus leverages next generation genomic sequencing, AI, and machine learning to determine what treatment will be most effective for a particular patient, first in cancer and now in several other disciplines. Tempus ranks #6 on the 2020 CNBC Disruptor List and is a Chicago-based unicorn whose last valuation exceeded $8 billion. 

Prior to Tempus, Andy was the General Counsel at Uptake Technologies, a Company that provides artificial intelligence software to heavy industry and predicts failures in large machines. During his tenure at Uptake, Andy also served as the interim Chief Financial Officer and Chief People Officer. In 2015, Uptake became the third unicorn in Illinois. The Company raised $100 million in Series D funding, which led Pitchbook to name it the fastest U.S. startup ever to reach a $2B valuation. 

Before transitioning to help lead growth stage technology companies, Andy was an accomplished trial lawyer. He served as an Assistant United States Attorney in the Northern District of Illinois and was an equity partner at Bartlit Beck, one of the nation’s leading trial boutiques. His practice at Bartlit Beck focused on "Deals Gone Bad," and spanned every aspect of bet-the-company commercial litigation. Andy also clerked for the Honorable Joel M. Flaum, then-Chief Judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit.

Andy serves on the Board of Directors of CARPLS, a legal aid organization serving the Chicago community whose mission is to provide free access to a lawyer to anyone who needs one. The American Lawyer once called CARPLS the most efficient legal aid organization in the country, and its use of technology to provide legal services is cutting edge. 

Andy graduated magna cum laude from Northwestern University School of Law (where he served as an adjunct professor of law for several years), and received a BA, cum laude, from Colgate University.

About:
Abdul Hamid Halabi heads up the Translational Artificial Intelligence business for Tempus Labs, a leader in AI & Precision Medicine. Abdul drives the strategy for digital and AI solutions across oncology, urology, and pathology. Abdul is building Tempus Edge, a platform enabling Actionable AI applications to pathology supporting Precision Medicine initiatives for Patients. In addition, Abdul Launched Tempus LENS, data and AI precision medicine platform enabling scalable access to genotypic and phenotypic data and rapid insight for the life science community. 

Before that Abdul Hamid Halabi led NVIDIA’s healthcare startup driving business growth and innovation into medicine and medical devices.  He has been at the forefront of advanced technologies in AI and HPC for several decades, working with top global thought leaders and world-class organizations, such as the American College of Radiology to bring AI to Healthcare.  Abdul launched NVIDIA’s Health platform, Clara to reach thousands of developers and deployment sites. He also grew NVIDIA’s healthcare industry presence to a healthy 9-figure and accelerating business. Abdul pioneered key concepts of intelligent medical devices and hospitals of the future.  Prior to his current role, Abdul was a leader within NVIDIA’s engineering organization where he led the Hardware Design effort of the mobile processor powering NVIDIA’s DRIVE platform.
